website_summaries.verdict: A good all-in-one recording solution with premium recording capabilities for serious videographers.
pros: Great noise reduction capabilities including RF resistance
Independently powered to prevent signal loss or battery strain
cons: Fails to eliminate noises from behind the camera
Does not fare well as a true shotgun microphone

customer_reviews.title: Weak Plastic! Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this mic for a couple years, but I have only used it a handful of times. I keep it in a safe location and I always am cautious with gear. I am surprised how brittle and weak the plastic is and how it snapped. I would not recommend this to any run and gun shooters. I think the design is way too fragile. Sound quality was not bad at all, but durability is lacking. Looked on their site for a replacement part, but it doesn't look like they sell new arms. Maybe I can superglue it.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Hiss
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this mic is so popular, it creates a lot of hiss. I compared it to the Azden SMX-30 and the Azden sound quality was much better and produced very little hiss compared to this mic. I'm still looking for a different mic though because the Azden smx-30 does not work with my on-camera mixer even though the Shure Lenshopper vp83 and Takstar 698 mics both work without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: ChinkyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Crisp clear inside and out
customer_reviews.text: Choose this one! I tried this Shure and Rode Videomic Pro and chose THIS. The has 1 AA battery the other 9V, like your smoke detectors. The Shure battery is an easy slide in, the other is almost impossible, I thought I would break it. NOW the sound, with my Canon 80D I feel the sound is a little better. I like the Shure is smaller made of metal vs plastic even the Fuzzy windscreen fits better. This is made in China vs the other Australia. Pricing a a little less but with the attached Fuzz / dead-cat this is has a more expensive total. I thing worth it.
customer_reviews.author: 68EagleTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good as a backup mic or for run and gun situations.
customer_reviews.text: This is designed as an on-camera mic, and as a result is limited in quality - you will pickup operator noise, and the mic is too far from the talent for most situations, resulting on low levels and/or excessive ambient noise. I do like the internal recording card as a safety feature. Build quality seems average - lots of plastic and exposed wire that could fail - but I have not had any issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing upgrade to stock camcorder mic.
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the best upgrade I made to my AX-53 purchase. The sound quality is amazing, battery life is 100+ hours. It is well built and takes your sound from "ok" with the stock mic to "AMAZING". It looks cool too! Shure has never let me down and I plan on using this for years to come and hope it outlasts my cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M.

customer_reviews.title: ) The one plus is that the size is great for on-the-go vlogging
customer_reviews.text: The sound is AWFUL. Picks up on random frequencies in the background that's distracting to the forefront vocals. I tried to equalize it in post-production and didn't get what I wanted. (I also don't want to be doing that for every footage I capture.) The one plus is that the size is great for on-the-go vlogging. I switched to the RODE Videomic Pro and feel the exact opposite of the Shure: LOVE the sound, hate the big size.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Weirdo

customer_reviews.title: Go with this (better than the Rode)
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. Make sure to read the instructions because it tells you to turn down your audio to the lowest setting. This mic has a lot of pickup! So make sure that you do this. It captures great sound. It's size is incredibly small, I was almost in shock when I first received it! The reason I chose this over the Rode VideoPro is the quality of the build, and how well it does around cell phones. The Rode has a huge interference problem and with this mic you can't even tell that there is a cellphone around.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: All around great mic with portable power.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to swap in and out with my Zoom H6 and after much research I decided we would go with the Shure VP83. Sound quality is wonderful and have experienced no issues connected to the Canon M5. The sound quality is very similar to the H6 Boom Mic. This mic is very portable and built sturdy. We have experienced no movement sounds when using it for Vlogs. I would recommended this product to anyone looking to get a directional mic for interviews, vlogging, or recording special events.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Shure is the best.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Having tried the Shure lightning motiv, several lapel mics and own a blue yeti as well, I can say for portability and quality, this shotgun mic is amazing, possibly the best out there. It's currently mounted on a beast grip phone mount to a bendy joby tripod. Using a Rode trf to trrf adapter, then 3.5mm to lightning adapter, I've got it plugged into my iPhone 7+. Highly recommend this if you're looking to spend over 150 on a quality mic.
customer_reviews.author: Colin C.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding mic!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding mic! If your camera doesn't have an eighth inch mic input, be sure to get and 1/8th female to male XLR adapter. Has 3 gain settings and can send as a mic or line level. It uses 1 AA battery which lasts for 18 hours in my experience and does not need phantom power. I great deal!
customer_reviews.author: William Smith

customer_reviews.title: and the jack does not fit easily into Canon cameras
customer_reviews.text: This mic only works half the time, and the jack does not fit easily into Canon cameras. You have to toggle and mess with it too much, and if it gets bumped at all you lose the sound. I haven't compared other mics but for the price you should be able to plug it in and go.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wright

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving how easy this is to use as well as the really descent sound quality. I own almost every piece of gear in the book from lavs to overhead 416's. Yet I always go to this mic as it's so easy. That will really need to be the next priority... Single user focused equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Falk

customer_reviews.title: It has different settings to use for every day recording or other types of recording like concerts. It is easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact microphone that records very well. It has different settings to use for every day recording or other types of recording like concerts. It is easy to operate, Takes a standard AA battery, and The battery life is long. The only complaint I have and it's a camera issue more than the microphone issue is that my point-and-shoot flash doesn't operate when the microphone is attached to the hot shoe. Canon makes a point and shoot camera that has an external microphone outlet. So if you take still shots that require a flash in the middle of video footage, the microphone must be removed. Otherwise, it is just as advertised. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Darski

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from a small package
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from a small package. Hot/cold shoe mount is perfect, and has thread underneath (though I can't remember if it's 3/8 or 1/4 20...) if you want to use that instead. Battery compartment is a little awkward to get to, but being this super compact, I guess it was the only choice. Shock mount felt a little fragile at first, but I've bumped this thing several time without breaking it, so I'm not worried.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Microphone is very good. Body is made out of aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Microphone is very good. Body is made out of aluminum. It uses 1 AA battery. Its a little heavy compare to Rode Go but it looks like its gonna stand more abuse. The sound is good. Just make sure the setting is correct. It is cheaper than Rode too when I bought mine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bass

customer_reviews.title: The adjustable sensitivity is also something that I like and swtiching between the options doesn't give out any ...
customer_reviews.text: The metallic feel of this mic gives me confidence that it would preform as well as the price and I am sure that it does exactly that. The adjustable sensitivity is also something that I like and swtiching between the options doesn't give out any hissing or distortions. The battery compartment is very easy to open and it is easy to insert and take out the battery, but do pay attention to the battery indicator. The shock mount is durable and it does its job. Packaging is very good, but I don't need to say that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mic for recording voice with videos
customer_reviews.text: Seriously in love with this mike. have been using it to record audio for my vlogs. Has 3 modes to take in amount of sound, can be adjusted as per the ambient noise. The sound has been clean and clear with less surround noise. One of the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Avinash Shimoga Ganesh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing microphone, but mine broke after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best mics on the market if your camera settings are right. HOWEVER, after only 15 months of use my microphone no longer functions properly. It doesn't record in dual-mono anymore, and there is an audible pop that randomly comes on when I'm speaking and causes the mic to malfunction for a few seconds. Shure support says this isn't normal, but this is my only experience with the VP83. I think it sounds better than Rode mics and I may purchase a Shure again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic build quality, clear pickup, metal housing, 1 AA battery for 125 hours of batter life. Great for hiking & backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: David Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Very good and built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot, it's almost as good as the Rode Pro but quite a bit smaller. Audio quality is very good, not excellent but very good.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Wright

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this microphone
customer_reviews.text: Better directionality than competitors. 1 AA battery is practical and easy to power and use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Finn

customer_reviews.title: Recommended microphone for DSLR type camera from Casey Neistat
customer_reviews.text: Recommended microphone for DSLR type camera from Casey Neistat. It seems to work well and runs off of one AA battery. Just remember to turn off the microphone when not in use to save battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Easley

customer_reviews.title: Even with  the ceiling fan on !
customer_reviews.text: This Shure (VP83 LensHopper Camera-Mounted Condenser)...is just a agreat Mic. I use it primarily inside is a small office studio. We just completer Sixty (one to two minute) Youtube product videos. Even with the ceiling fan on as well as another on the floor our sound quality is great. because of tour using two fans we chose to use the Slip over Windscreen. Also be sure to get the shoe adaptor. We shoot on an older Canon XVIXA HF s100 and I very happy with the sound input and output .... Great value for me! Happy campers here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than rode!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a vlogger and wanted a smaller shotgun mic. This is the mic yo uwanna get if you don't wanna get a rode mic! this mic is my go to and hasn't let me down yet!
customer_reviews.author: GenVicious

customer_reviews.title: Great mix so far...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and video audio is of much higher quality than built in mic on my Nikon d5200. Glad I invested in this outboard mic. So far, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo M.

customer_reviews.title: glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Thought about the RODE but went with the Shure... glad I did. Stores in camera bag compactly. Very happy with it... very nice mic for the price and size.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This mic is great!! Super clear and picks up everything I ...
customer_reviews.text: This mic is great!! Super clear and picks up everything I want it to. I'm a fan of Shure mics and I sure wasn't disappointed with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good addition to my bag
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the microphone this Shure replaced... well there is no comparison. This microphone delivers exactly what Shure claims it will, clear, bright audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Shotgun mics
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. Feels a lot more durable than other brands of shotguns for cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Markatekt

customer_reviews.title: Great mic. Built better than competitors in its class
customer_reviews.text: Great mic. Built better than competitors in its class. It's got great battery life and the battery is easy to get to when it does need replacing. Wish it came on automatically when record is pushed but oh well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: One of the best. Can't go wrong with Shure. You can record anything from crickets up to a front-row rock concert. You just have to know how to adjust the gain on camera and/or mic with low pass filter. I have used it on my Nikon D810 and GoPro 3 cameras with excellent results. I would recommend also getting the dead cat noise cover for the mic for anything outside as it definitely cuts wind noise. Pricey but probably a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: T. StreiffTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Shure has been making microphones well before I was born. Great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shotgun mic?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Canon Vixia R400. Didn't work as well as I hoped. As a shotgun microphone it didn't diminish sounds from behind the microphone very well. Everything else about the product was fine. Being an outdoor videographer sometimes my breathing is winded and I don't want that on my films.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Shure is a fantastic brand that's been around forever.
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely sold on this mic! It does everything I need it to do. I records clear rich sound. The battery life is also fantastic. I've shot probably 20 hours worth of video with this mic and the single AA still testes good. I'd pic this mic over RODE any day. This mic is all metal and made with quality components.
customer_reviews.author: ClassicEndurance80

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and features.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance and battery life. After listening to many YouTube comparison videos, the Shure VP83 held the most accurate recording. The Rhode was great for voice but dropped the highs when recording a guitar. I use this to record straight to my Sony A65 in a small meeting room.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cripe

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the two times I used it
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the two times I used it. The plastic part where you plug the mic into the camera broke on my third usage so I am really disappointed in the ROI of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fix the Canon T3i's annoying movie sound
customer_reviews.text: I hate the loud hhhhhaaaaaaa sound that my Canon T3i camera makes most of the time when I shoot movies. (My little Canon Powershot A-series cameras don't make any sound while making videos.) The descriptions here made it sound like this microphone might do away with the T3i sound. It doesn't. Shooting out of doors, with lots of ambient sounds, the T3i sound is sometimes masked, but shooting through a window from inside a quiet house with distinct outdoor sounds coming through a nearby open window, I can't hear any difference between the T3i's built-in mic and this mic.
customer_reviews.author: RioMasGrande Mywords

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless $200+ is unimportant to you.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a Canon 70D camera. I listened to what they said and put the camera sound input at it's lowest it can go and turned the microphone to 20db+. If I get at least three feet away, I sounds like I'm in a tunnel. If I get three feet or closer, the microphone starts clipping like crazy. This microphone (for the price) just isn't good for DSLRs. If this was 50 bucks I would keep it. But over $200 for a microphone this bad? Yuck I'm returning it ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Recenello

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible as is with Sony
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up with my Sony DSLR and it doesn't fit! Purchasing an adapter that will hopefully fix the issue, but I would have preferred to know up front that it wasn't going to fit. Other than that, the sound seemed ok. It didn't pick up sounds from the camera which was my main aim to avoid. The sounds off the sides sound different since it's a shotgun mic, so not ideal for family shooting I concluded.
customer_reviews.author: Rundano-27491

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely disappointed - Content from Vacation... USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic because it was supposed to be the most "durable and reliable" in it's category. However the mic completely stopped recording audio at the beginning of my trip to Europe, just about as soon as I got off the second plane. I had it for 4 days before the trip, and it was working well. I'm extremely disappointed as all my vlog audio from a $15,000 trip to Europe is garbage now. Will never buy a shure product again.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Clicking noise
customer_reviews.text: This microphone gives good sound reproduction and has a good form factor and appearance. However, I returned the first one I received because it makes a clicking sound with any movement of the camera- not bouncing-of-the-floor movement, just pans using a tripod. I assumed it was defective and returned it for an exchange. However, the new one does the same thing. As I played more with it I realized that it was the little microswitches for on-off and low/high pass. It this was a $20 mike I would just tape down the switches, but for this price, it should be better designed. I guess I'll go with the Rode next...
customer_reviews.author: William R. Kimlinger

Highly directional super cardioid/lobar polar pattern rejects unwanted off-axis audio while clearly capturing the intended sound source.
Superior RF immunity to avoid against unwanted audio artifacts from cellular and RF devices.

Integrated Rycote Lyre shock mounting system provides superior isolation from vibration and mechanical noise through its customized, robust design exclusively developed with Rycote for the VP83 model.
